00020 ;FILE DESCRIPTION:
00021 ; This file contains a routine to convert hexadecimal A/D conversion
00022 ; results into decimal. This file also contains a routine to update
00023 ; the image of the LCD display buffer stored in the dsPIC30F device
00024 ; RAM.
00025 ;
00026 ;REVISION HISTORY:
00027 ;  $Log: DisplayRoutines.c,v $
00028 ;  Revision 1.1.1.1  2005/06/06 09:16:45  VasukiH
00029 ;  First release of software
00030 ;
00031 ;
00032 */
00033 
00034 //Pre-Processor Directives:
00035 #include <p30fxxxx.h>
00036 #include "system.h"
00037 #include "display_routines.h"
00038 //Declaration to Link External Functions & Variables:
00039 extern  int     TempSensor;
00040 extern  int     Potentiometer;
00041 
00042 //Functions and Variables with Global Scope:
00043 
00044 unsigned char DisplayData[] = "dsPICDEM2  Board\r\nT=+00C Pot=0.00v\r\n\r\n\0";
00045 unsigned char adones=0;
00046 unsigned char adtenths=0;
00047 unsigned char adhundredths=0;
00048 
00049 //UpdateDisplayBuffer() Function:
00050 //This function writes new A/D readings to the Display Buffer.
00051 //The display buffer stores a string to be displayed on both the RS232 and
00052 //the LCD.
00053 void UpdateDisplayBuffer(void)
00054 {
00055         int temp = 0;                   //Convert TC1047A reading to Deg
00056                                         //Celsius
00057         temp = TempSensor - 0x66;      //Determine if the temperature is
00058         if (temp > 0)                   //negative, in order to write
00059         {                               //either a + or - sign to display areas
00060                 DisplayData[20] = '+';
00061         }
00062         else
00063         {
00064                 temp = 0x66 - TempSensor;
00065                 DisplayData[20] = '-';
00066         }
00067 
00068         ADCResult2Decimal(temp);        //Convert the hex value to decimal
00069         DisplayData[21] = adtenths;     //Update the display buffer characters
00070         DisplayData[22] = adhundredths;
00071 
00072         ADCResult2Decimal(Potentiometer); //Convert the A/D hex value to
00073         DisplayData[29] = adones;       //decimal and update the display buffer
00074         DisplayData[31] = adtenths;
00075         DisplayData[32] = adhundredths;
00076 
00077 }
00078 
00079 //ADCResult2Decimal() Function:
00080 //This function converts a 10-bit A/D result in hexadecimal to decimal
00081 //assuming a 5 volt reference voltage.
00082 void ADCResult2Decimal(unsigned int ADRES)
00083 {
00084          adones = 0;            //reset values
00085          adtenths = 0;
00086          adhundredths = 0;
00087          while (ADRES > 0x8)
00088          {
00089                 if(ADRES > 0xCC)                //test for 1 volt or greater
00090                 {
00091                         adones++;                       //increment 1 volt counter
00092                         ADRES -= 0xCD;                  //subtract 1 volt
00093                 }
00094                 else if(ADRES > 0x14 && ADRES <= 0xCC)   //test for 0.1 volt or greater
00095                 {
00096                         if (adtenths < 9)
00097                         {
00098                           adtenths++;                   //increment tenths
00099                         }
00100                         else
00101                         {
00102                           adones++;                     //tenths has rolled over
00103                           adtenths = 0;                 //so increment ones and reset tenths
00104                         }
00105                         ADRES -=0x15;
00106                 }
00107                 else if(ADRES > 0x2 && ADRES <= 0x14)   //test for 0.01 volt or greater
00108                 {
00109                         if (adhundredths < 9)
00110                         {
00111                                 adhundredths++;         //increment hundreths
00112                         }
00113                         else
00114                         {
00115 
00116                                 adhundredths = 0;       //reset hundredths
00117                                 if (adtenths < 9)
00118                                 {
00119                                         adtenths++;                     //and increment tenths
00120                                 }
00121                                 else
00122                                 {
00123                                         adones++;                       //unless tenths has rolled over
00124                                         adtenths = 0;                   //so increment ones and reset tenths
00125                                 }
00126                         }
00127                         ADRES -= 0x3;
00128                 }
00129 
00130 
00131 
00132          }
00133         adones += 0x30;
00134         adtenths += 0x30;
00135         adhundredths += 0x30;
00136 
00137 }
